comment._content: See www.strathearnherald.co.uk/lifestyle/lifestyle-strathearn... 'The Strathearn Hydropathic Establishment, to give it its maiden name, was originally a resort designed to attract those recovering from illness “on account of its possessing, in the highest degree attainable, the essential quality of a pure, dry, bracing climate.” Hydropathics were a fashion of the era, using water therapy to aid most ills, and Crieff’s supply was described as “one of the purest and finest waters ever examined."' Still a family run hotel.
